organic_results.title: The impact of school desegregation programs on white public-school enrollment, 1968-1976
organic_results.snippet: This article examines the findings of a national study of the impact of school desegregation programs on white public-school enrollment trends in school districts grouped according to region, metropolitan status, and source of pressure to desegregate. The analysis is based on a larger and more diverse sample of districts than was used in previous studies. It shows that the increased exposure of white pupils to black pupils (or interracial contact) substantially affects the demography of school systems and leads to reductions in white …

publication_info.summary: FD Wilson - Sociology of Education, 1985 - JSTOR
